Articles.Content:
so to start off I have a heavily modded version of KSP 23.5 on my mac currently and the problem isn't with loading, once the game has been running for a few minutes (generally when I am trying to build a new craft) the game just decides to freeze, however the background music keeps playing. here is a list of everything in my gamedata folder

000_Toolbar

ActiveTextureManagement

AdaptiveDockingNode

AJE

AtmosphericSoundEnhancement

AutoAsparagus

B9_Aerospace (with some patches)

BoulderCo

Chatterer

ConnectedLivingSpace

DistantObject

DV

Engineer

EnhancedNavBall

EnvironmentalVisualEnhancements

ExsurgentEngineering

FerramAerospaceResearch

Firespitter

FloorItPro.dll

Fusebox

Hot Beverage Inc

KAS

KashCorp

Keramzit

KerbalJointReinforcement

KineTechAnimation

KipEng

LandingHeight

MagicSmokeIndustries

MechJeb2

Mechjeb2 Embedded (puts mechjeb in command pods)

MobiusRocketWorks

ModuleManager (folder

ModuleManager 2.0.7.2.dll

MP_Nazari

NASAmission

NavBAllDockingAlignmentindicator

NavyFish

NearFuture

NewHorizons

NothkeSerCom

NovaPunch2

OpenResourceSystem

ProceduralDynamics

ProceduralFairings

pwb

RCSBuildAid

RealChute

RealFuels

ResGen

RLA_Stockalike

SCANsat

SCANsatRPM

ShipManifest

SmokeScreen

SpeedUnitChanger

Squad

toolbar-settings.dat

TreeLoader

TriggerTech

WarpPlugin

please help me I don't want to remove my mods, but I want to be able to play kerbal. as far as I know all mods are current or at least ARM compatible

Edit: I just removed Kethane and the NASA pack, and severely reduced settings. now the game no longer freezes in the VAB or Hangar, however it freezes while loading the VAB after attempting a launch

Edited June 16, 2014 by jab136
Well, unless if you want to install the 64 bit KSP hotfix. You will have to remove some mods as for you are above the 4 Gig RAM limit

Well, unless if you want to install the 64 bit KSP hotfix. You will have to remove some mods as for you are above the 4 Gig RAM limit

what hotfix? is it mac compatible?
Right Here. It doesn't work on Macs. But the guy said if you use Bootcamp, it should work. Not guarenteed

What does the output_log.txt (inside KSP_Data) tells you after it freeze? It could be something else than the memory (as it would usualy crash and not freeze).

If it's a memory issue, you can have a look at that mod: http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/59005-0-23-Release-2-7-Active-Memory-Reduction-Mod

What does the output_log.txt (inside KSP_Data) tells you after it freeze? It could be something else than the memory (as it would usualy crash and not freeze).

If it's a memory issue, you can have a look at that mod: http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/59005-0-23-Release-2-7-Active-Memory-Reduction-Mod

thanks for the tip, but I am already using active texture management

also just checked the log and it doesn't say it crashed, the game just froze and I had to force quit

thanks for the tip, but I am already using active texture management

also just checked the log and it doesn't say it crashed, the game just froze and I had to force quit

I experience this too with a Mac Pro (OSX 10.7) and 6gb of RAM. KSP doesn't do this on my MacBook Pro which has only 4gb of RAM. What the hell?

I experience this too with a Mac Pro (OSX 10.7) and 6gb of RAM. KSP doesn't do this on my MacBook Pro which has only 4gb of RAM. What the hell?

yah I am running 10.9.3 on 8gb I don't think it is directly related to either

The "freeze with music still playing" happens to me whenever I attempt re-entry with aerodynamic settings above minimal. As soon as the re-entry effects begin, I have to force quit and restart. It happens in stock, too.

I'm also on a Macbook Pro, OSX 10.7.5 with 4gb.
I had this problem as well. It could actually be only one mod causing conflicts with others.

I got the game working (deleted the NASA pack as well as kethane) but now when I try to go back into the spaceplane hanger after attempting a launch the game freezes on the loading screen. I also lowered some of the settings for the game.
I have this too! Whenever I try to revert a flight, which I do often (I don't like killing kerbals), KSP freezes and when I force quit, it says "KSP (Not responding)"
Please start a new thread in the Support (modded installs) forum, and follow the instructions in the How To Get Support sticky. Support for modded KSP now goes to that forum, under those rules.
